text:
*Lead Data scientist*
*Location: London or St Petersburg*
*Salary: £60.000- £80.000 (annual gross)*
*Company: <http://pitchme.co|pitchme.co>*

*Position Overview*

We are looking for a highly motivated data scientist, who will combine software engineering skills with a strong understanding of data driven problem-solving to join our team which is driving innovation in hiring, education and learning. This job is all about coming to grips with the ways to convert big data into measured and validated professional and personal skills.

At PitchMe data science plays a critical role in delivering our main product – innovative talent marketplace. The team is responsible for developing models for classifying, validating, and understanding the big data in relation to professional and personal skills of the person; ensuring and maintaining data quality; and building machine learning driven algorithms to help guide our candidates through their career journey.

We process job postings, resumes, and professional profiles to better answer questions about what skills a person has, what skills are demanded in the workforce, what skills should be learned, and where the opportunities lie for job-seekers. We’re looking for people who have the technical skills and an interest in solving problems like: what are the best ways to extract professional skills from GitHub, how to calculate leadership skill based on social media presence or how to process 12.000.000 job postings and load them into Elasticsearch effectively?

*Responsibilities*

·      Reporting directly to head of R&D and CTO be responsible for the process of SmartMe profile creation
·      Implement and optimise existing methodology of big data conversion into measured and validated skills
·      Constantly look for new data sources applicable for data extraction for skills assessment purposes
·      Transition into machine learning workflows
·      Implement best practices for retraining models as well as monitoring the performance of models in production
·      Collaborate with junior data scientist, engineering, and product development teams to create requirements for the deployment of new machine learning models

*About you*
·      5+ years experience in a professional setting.
·      Strong software engineering and programming skills
·      Proficiency with Python and machine learning frameworks
·      Experience with lean/agile development and test-driven development practices, preferred.
·      AWS ecosystem for ML
·      Experience with deployment and building APIs

Please feedback me regarding the job description. The role is complex and would love to pick your brain!
If interested, please DM me or send a CV to <mailto:info@pitchme.co|info@pitchme.co>

text: Вот мы и дожили до того момента, когда в требованиях к lead DS перестали писать собственно DS и ML

text:
Если придумана рабочая стратегия, то выплата по ней разовая или пропорциональна заработку на бирже?
Если придумать стратегию, которая будет зарабатывать без постоянного тюнинга, вы будете платить уже не работающему кванту?
Не может быть так, что ваш симулятор сильно пессимистичен и на нем не зарабатывает то, что могло бы заработать на реальных торгах? Это даёт возможность брать рабочую стратегию, говорить, что она барахло, а самим на ней зарабатывать. Либо в любой момент подкрутить симуляцию и сказать, что больше стратегия не зарабатывает, поэтому денег нет.
